009package imagingbook.core.resource;
010
011import java.io.File;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.net.URI;
014import java.net.URISyntaxException;
015import java.net.URL;
016import java.nio.file.FileSystem;
017import java.nio.file.FileSystemNotFoundException;
018import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
019import java.nio.file.Files;
020import java.nio.file.Path;
021import java.nio.file.Paths;
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Iterator;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.stream.Stream;
027
028
029/**
030 * <p>
031 * This class defines static methods for accessing resources. What makes things
032 * somewhat complex is the requirement that we want to retrieve resources
033 * located in the file system or contained inside a JAR file.
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * Here is a typical URI for a JAR-embedded file:
037 * {@code "jar:file:/C:/PROJEC~2/parent/IM1D84~1/ImageJ/jars/jarWithResources.jar!/jarWithResouces/resources/clown.jpg"}
038 * </p>
039 *
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/11/01
042 */
043public abstract class ResourceUtils {
044        
045        private ResourceUtils() {}
046        
047        /**
048         * Determines if the specified class was loaded from
049         * a JAR file or a .class file in the file system.
050         * 
051         * @param clazz the class
052         * @return true if contained in a JAR file, false otherwise
053         */
054        public static boolean isInsideJar(Class<?> clazz) {
055                URL url = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation();
056                String path = url.getPath();
057                File file = new File(path);
058                return file.isFile();
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * Finds the URI for a resource relative to a specified class.
063         * The resource may be located in the file system or
064         * inside a JAR file.
065         * 
066         * @param clazz the anchor class
067         * @param relPath the resource path relative to the anchor class
068         * @return the URI or {@code null} if the resource was not found
069         */
070        public static URI getResourceUri(Class<?> clazz, String  relPath) {
071                URI uri = null;
072                if (isInsideJar(clazz)) {
073                        String classPath = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getFile();
074                        //String packagePath = clazz.getPackage().getName().replace('.', File.separatorChar);
075                        String packagePath = clazz.getPackage().getName().replace('.', '/');
076                        String compPath = "jar:file:" + classPath + "!/" + packagePath + "/" + relPath;
077                        try {
078                                uri = new URI(compPath);
079                        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
080                                // throw new RuntimeException("getResourceURI: " + e.toString());
081                        }       
082                }
083                else {  // regular file path
084                        try {
085                                uri = clazz.getResource(relPath).toURI();
086                        } catch (Exception e) {
087                                //do nothing, just return null - was: throw new RuntimeException("getResourceURI: " + e.toString());
088                        }
089                }
090                return uri;
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * <p>
095         * Finds the path to a resource relative to the location of some class.
096         * Example: Assume class C was loaded from file {@code someLocation/C.class}
097         * and there is a subfolder {@code someLocation/resources/} that contains 
098         * an image file {@code lenna.jpg}. Then the complete path to this image
099         * is obtained by 
100         * </p>
101         * <pre>
102         * Path path = getResourcePath(C.class, "resources/lenna.jpg");
103         * </pre>
104         * 
105         * @param clazz anchor class 
106         * @param relPath the path of the resource to be found (relative to the location of the anchor class)
107         * @return the path to the specified resource
108         * @version 2016/06/03: modified to return proper path to resource inside a JAR file.
109         */
110        public static Path getResourcePath(Class<?> clazz, String relPath) {
111                URI uri = getResourceUri(clazz, relPath);
112                if (uri != null) {
113                        return uriToPath(uri);
114                }
115                else {
116                        return null;
117                }
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Converts an {@link URI} to a {@link Path} for locations that are either in
122         * the file system or inside a JAR file.
123         * 
124         * @param uri the specified location
125         * @return the associated path
126         */
127        public static Path uriToPath(URI uri) {
128                Path path = null;
129                String scheme = uri.getScheme();
130                switch (scheme) {
131                case "jar":     {       // resource inside JAR file
132                        FileSystem fs = null;
133                        try { // check if this FileSystem already exists 
134                                fs = FileSystems.getFileSystem(uri);
135                        } catch (FileSystemNotFoundException e) {
136                                // that's OK to happen, the file system is not created automatically
137                        }
138                        
139                        if (fs == null) {       // must not create the file system twice
140                                try {
141                                        fs = FileSystems.newFileSystem(uri, Collections.<String, Object>emptyMap());
142                                } catch (IOException e) {
143                                        throw new RuntimeException("uriToPath: " + e.toString());
144                                }
145                        }
146                        
147                        String ssp = uri.getSchemeSpecificPart();
148                        int startIdx = ssp.lastIndexOf('!');
149                        String inJarPath = ssp.substring(startIdx + 1);  // in-Jar path (after the last '!')
150                        path = fs.getPath(inJarPath);
151                        break;
152                }
153                case "file": {  // resource in ordinary file system
154                        path = Paths.get(uri);
155                        break;
156                }
157                default:
158                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot handle this URI type: " + scheme);
159                }
160                return path;
161        }
162        
163        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(URI uri) {
164                return getResourcePaths(uriToPath(uri));
165        }
166        
167        /**
168         * Method to obtain the paths to all files in a directory specified by a {@link Path}
169         * (non-recursively). This should work in an ordinary file system as well as a
170         * (possibly nested) JAR file.
171         * 
172         * @param path {@link Path} to a directory (may be contained in a JAR file)
173         * @return a possibly empty sequence of paths
174         */
175        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(Path path) {
176                // with help from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1429172/how-do-i-list-the-files-inside-a-jar-file, #10
177                if (!Files.isDirectory(path)) {
178                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("path is not a directory: " + path.toString());
179                }
180                
181                List<Path> pathList = new ArrayList<Path>();
182                Stream<Path> walk = null;
183                try {
184                        walk = Files.walk(path, 1);
185                } catch (IOException e) {
186                        e.printStackTrace();
187                }
188
189                for (Iterator<Path> it = walk.iterator(); it.hasNext();){
190                        Path p = it.next();
191                        if (Files.isRegularFile(p) && Files.isReadable(p)) {
192                                pathList.add(p);
193                        }
194                }
195                walk.close();
196                return pathList.toArray(new Path[0]);
197        }
198        
199        /**
200         * Use this method to obtain the paths to all files in a directory located
201         * relative to the specified class (non-recursively). This should work in an
202         * ordinary file system as well as a (possibly nested) JAR file.
203         * 
204         * @param clazz class whose source location defines the root
205         * @param relPath path relative to the root
206         * @return a possibly empty array of paths
207         */
208        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(Class<?> clazz, String relPath) {
209                URI uri = getResourceUri(clazz, relPath);
210                if (uri == null) {
211                        throw new RuntimeException("uri is null for resource class " + clazz.getSimpleName()
212                                        + " and relative path " + relPath);
213                }
214                return getResourcePaths(uri);
215        }
216        
217        /**
218         * Use this method to obtain the names of all files in a directory located
219         * relative to the specified class (non-recursively). This should work in an
220         * ordinary file system as well as a (possibly nested) JAR file.
221         * 
222         * @param clazz  class whose source location specifies the root
223         * @param relDir directory relative to the root
224         * @return a possibly empty array of file names
225         */
226        public static String[] getResourceFileNames(Class<?> clazz, String relDir) {
227                Path[] paths = ResourceUtils.getResourcePaths(clazz, relDir);
228                List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
229                for (Path p : paths) {
230                        names.add(p.getFileName().toString());
231                }
232                return names.toArray(new String[0]);
233        }
234
235}
